column3: Introduction to Art History I: Antiquity to the Middle Ages

column3: Imperial Reflections: Early Modern Islamic Art and Architecture
column4: b'imperial styles, intersections between art and politics, and the importance of the arts in dynastic legitimization.'

column3: After Genghis Khan: Art and Architecture in Central Asia and Iran
column4: b"he most innovative  and  dynamic artistic traditions of the Islamic world, and heirs to the  traditions  of Genghis Khan's Mongol Empire. This course fulfills a single  unit in the  following BU Hub area(s): Aesthetic Exploration, Global  Citizenship and  Intercultural Literacy, Research and Information Literacy."

column3: African Diaspora Arts in the Americas
column4: b'm the period of slavery to the present. Topics include Kongo and Yoruba  arts and their influence on the arts of Santeria, Vodun, and carnival. Also offered as CAS AA 316.'

column3: From Morocco to Timbuktu: Art and Architecture at the Saharan Crossroads
column4: b'tion between Islam and other modes of African religious practice and how this interaction influenced African aesthetic expression.'
